author: Staff Reporter
text:
In 2015, Bengaluru consumed 7.8 crore litres of beer, and with summer already making an early entry in 2016, the All India Brewers Association estimates this year’s beer consumption will be on the rise.

According to the association’s data, over 26 million cases of beer were consumed in Karnataka last year with Bengaluru drinking 10 million cases.

“The city has a lot of young crowd, disposable income and people who want choices mainly in beer. There are a good number of local brands and five foreign brands,” said Shobhan Roy, Director General, AIBA.

Ashish Kothare, chapter head of National Restaurant Association of India (NRAI) and city restaurant owner, believes that Bengaluru’s beer drinkers have increased in the last few years.

“The sales of beer have definitely gone up in the city with the summers becoming longer and winters turning shorter. Many don’t feel like going in for hard alcohol,” said Kothare.

Beer has become the choice of drink for both men and women. AIBA experts expect the beer consumption figures in the city to climb to 8.5 crore litres by the end of 2016.

Meanwhile, the State consumed over 26 million cases of beer

last year
title: Bengaluru guzzled 10 million cases of beer in 2015: survey
